lcInstruction.p: At a minimum, the glossary entry topic must contain a <glossentry> (glossary entry) root element (with an id attribute) that contains a <glossterm> (glossary term) element.
The <glossterm> element is a specialization of the <title> element. The <glossterm> element can contain any element that a <title> can contain.
Following the <glossterm> element, a <glossdef> element contains the definition. The <glossdef> element can contain any element that is allowed in the <section> element, except <title>.

step.cmd: Make a copy of the file l_gloss_start.dita and open it in your editor.

info.note: If you are using a DITA-aware text editor, make sure you are in text mode, rather than author or visual mode.

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <!DOCTYPE glossentry PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Glossary//EN" "glossary.dtd"> <glossentry id="glossentry_eyd_vrt_qt"> <glossterm></glossterm> </glossentry>

info.p: The first line (which begins with <?xml) is an XML declaration, which is a standard part of all XML files.

The second line is the DOCTYPE declaration, which tells DITA editors or DITA output generators that this is a DITA glossentry topic. The programs then use that information when validating the content of the topic. The DOCTYPE will be specific to each topic type that you create.
The third line contains the opening tag of the <glossentry> element.
The fourth line contains the <glossterm> element.

step.cmd: Inside the <glossterm> element, insert the glossary term to be defined.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "task.dtd"> <task id="my_first_task"> <title>Watching wild ducks</title>
</task>

step.cmd: After the <title> element, add a <taskbody> element.
step.info: The <taskbody> element contains all the actual content in the task.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "task.dtd"> <task id="my_first_task"> <title>Watching wild ducks</title> <taskbody>
</taskbody>Â </task>

step.info: This is the essential part of a DITA strict task topic. The rest of this lesson shows you how to add the first two child elements to the <taskbody> element.
